The following significant corporate developments for GRASIM Ltd were published on or around August 27, 2025, primarily citing information from the company's 78th Annual General Meeting (AGM) on August 26, 2025:

Expansion of chemical business:The company announced it will commission two new chemical facilities, for Epichlorohydrin (ECH) and Chlorinated Polyvinyl Chloride (CPVC), at its Vilayat plant during fiscal year 2025–26. Grasim stated this expansion will strengthen its position in the advanced materials market.

Market capitalization milestone:Grasim's chairman, Kumar Mangalam Birla, announced that the company's market capitalization had reached an all-time high of approximately ₹1,95,000 crore, putting it within "striking distance" of the ₹2 lakh crore milestone.

Capital expenditure details:The company highlighted its substantial capital expenditure, noting that between FY20 and FY25, it spent ₹67,000 crore. Of this, ₹51,000 crore was allocated to growth initiatives, including its core businesses and new ventures.

B2B e-commerce platform growth:Grasim provided an update on its B2B e-commerce platform, Birla Pivot, stating it has reached a revenue run rate of over ₹5,500 crore. The platform is also a key component of the company's strategy to expand into new, high-growth areas.

Growth in the decorative paints segment:Updates were provided on the new decorative paints venture, Birla Opus. At the AGM, Birla noted the "meteoric rise" of the business and confirmed that a sixth manufacturing facility would be commissioned soon. This will give Birla Opus an estimated 24% of India's total installed capacity in decorative paints.
